original: Botvidzon, Gustaf (Gösta) Josef, civilingenjör, löjtnant, Motala, f. 16/ 12/92 i V. Vingåker, Södermani. 1., av länsträdg:mäst. Gustaf Botvid Anderson o. Charilo’tta Wi|lhelmina Åkerlund. G. 22 m. Ebba Holm. Barn: Anna-Stina o: Inga-Brita ff. 26, Lena 32. — Stud:ex. 12, res:off:ex. 15, ut-ex. fr. KTH (E) 18. Fänr. i Söderm. reg. res. 16, löjtn. 20. Anst. v. vat-tenf:styr. 18, v. Älvkarleby kraftv. 18, v. Motala kraftv. sed. 23, distr :ing. där sed. 35. Intr. i biografbranschen 32, förest, f. fd. Rivoilibiogr. i Motala o. f. Roxybiogr. sed. 36 samt även f. Royalbiogr. sed. 41. Fd. led. av stads-fuWm., led. av folksk istyr. i Motala. Led. av Sv. tekn:fören. RVO 40.
translated:
Botvidzon, Gustaf (Gösta) Josef, a civil engineer and lieutenant from Motala, was born on December 16, 1892 in Västra Vingåker, Södermanland, Sweden. He was the first child of the county horticulturist Gustaf Botvid Anderson and Charlotta Wilhelmina Åkerlund. He was married to Ebba Holm in 1922 and had three children: Anna-Stina and Inga-Brita in 1926, and Lena in 1932. 

He graduated from high school in 1912, completed his military training in 1915, and received his engineering degree from KTH (E) in 1918. He served as a second lieutenant in the Södermanland regiment in 1916 and was promoted to lieutenant in 1920. He was employed in the water power industry, starting in 1918 with the water supply agency, then moving to Älvkarleby power station in 1918, and finally working at Motala power station from 1923 onwards, where he eventually became a district engineer in 1935. 

He entered the cinema industry in 1932, managing the former Rivoili cinema and the Roxy cinema from 1936, and additionally the Royal cinema from 1941 onwards. He was a former member of the city welfare committee and a member of the school board in Motala, as well as a member of the Swedish Society of Engineers. He was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa in 1940.
